entry.title: Fwd: [BIP 15] Aliases
entry.summary: The email chain discusses the proposal for standard URLs in Bitcoin. The sender of the initial email expresses their preference for plain URLs, which are easy to implement and understand. Another person in the thread suggests using an HTTPS service that responds with a Bitcoin address when a user contacts a designated URL. However, this idea is met with criticism as it involves hard-coding mappings and making choices on behalf of server operators. Instead, the suggestion is made to use URLs that can be customized by the author of the service. This allows for greater flexibility and less confusion for users. The benefits of using URLs for identification purposes are also mentioned.
